text: Zanzye H.A. Hill (1906-1935) was Nebraska’s first African American female lawyer. Hill was born on January 12, 1906 to P.M.E. and Eliza Hill. In 1929, Hill—who was also a poet—became the University of Nebraska-Lincoln’s first African American female law graduate. Shortly after, Hill became the first African American female admitted to practice law in Nebraska. Hill worked as chief counsel for an Arkansas insurance company before passing away on April 4, 1935. == See also == * List of first women lawyers and judges in Nebraska == References == Category:Nebraska lawyers Category:University of Nebraska–Lincoln alumni Category:1906 births Category:1935 deaths Category:20th-century American lawyers Category:20th-century American women lawyers
title: Zanzye H.A. Hill
